result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M. Skinner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling per agent.  Submit to DNA sample.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Upon successful completion of probation and restitution paid in full, record may be expunged, 973.015.

records.addlTxt: judgment for unpaid fines, forfeitures and other financial obligations & judgment/notice of entry of judgment

Defendant Christopher M. Skinner in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Christopher M. Skinner in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and State states appearances and states parties are ready to proceed.  Atty Tsai states there is a joint recommendation.  State states recommendations and notes victims have been notified w/no response.  Atty Tsai makes statement.  Court questions parties re: jail credit.  Parties go off the record to discuss credit.  Court notes parties agree 40 days previously served were as a condition of probation to those wouldn't apply.  Parties agree 70 days would be the correct amount of credit.  Court sentences.

15CM256
6 months jail w/huber concurrent to sentence in 15CM357 to commence forthwith
EMP approved per jail rules
May serve in Juneau Co if accepted
70 days jail credit to be applied
All unpaid costs, surchartges, restitution, etc to be converted to civil judgments

15CM357
6 months jail w/huber concurrent to sentence in 15CM256
EMP approved per jail rules

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher M. Skinner in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  Dismiss /read in Count  2 & 3.  State gives recommendation.  Attorney Tsai agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Victim statements reviewed by parties.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
18 months Probation, concurrent
Undergo any counseling per agent.
Restitution with 10% Surcharge per stipulations
$243.00 costs, $200.00 DNA surcharge and $10.00 property crime surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Expungement if restitution paid and completion of probation
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Christopher M. Skinner appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney ORourke advises defendant will be represented by Attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $400.00 cash bond w/ conditions.  Attorney ORourke advises of no warrant history.  Request signature bond.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  May not enter the premises of White Mound County Park.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
